result.execSummary:
The defendant Alonzo Marcus Lamar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; surcharge IMPOSED. Court waived non-mandatory court costs due to defendant's indigency. Court ordered mandatory costs, fees and surcharges (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by April 27, 2023. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: With 65 days credit for time served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alonzo Marcus Lamar

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Alonzo Marcus Lamar in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Alonzo Marcus Lamar in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk   Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 1:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   
Court ordered defendant to serve 65 days in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE, with 65 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank - surcharge IMPOSED.
Court set restitution at zero. 
Court waived non-mandatory court costs due to defendant's indigency.  Court ordered mandatory costs, fees and surcharges (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by April 27, 2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed

Attorney Jason A Findling in court, defendant Alonzo Marcus Lamar not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Alonzo Marcus Lamar in court with Student Intern Alyssah Foster under the supervision of Attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Alonzo Marcus Lamar in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alonzo Marcus Lamar appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
